events.text: [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]ORBRO!
HERB!
Trying out the new nickname!
Feels good! Rolls off the tongue.
Hey, Mrs. Langtree! You feeling okay?
As good as any day!
I’m glad!
And I wanted to say I’m sorry, Mrs. Langtree.

???
For what?

I didn’t get why you left early yesterday, and I was talking rude about you.
But after talking with Orven, I get that everyone deals with things differently, you know?
It doesn’t bother me that much, but it does bother you. And I gotta respect that.
So, I’m sorry, especially since you’re my friend!
I should care more about you than any “team morale” we have.

…...
Herwin, I’m surprised.
You impressed me. I appreciate and accept the apology.

I’m not going to lie, I don’t have a ton of friends like you, Herwin…
Though that’s probably because you remind me a little too much of my boys.

But, you were mature and big enough to apologize for something that I wouldn’t have even known about.
And I commend you and appreciate you for that, Herb, I truly do.
Thanks, Mrs. Langtree, I’m glad to be your friend.
As am I.
Oh, Orbro! I meant to tell you.
I heard from some guys that we’re going to be submitting our reviews to [b][i]different[/i] apothecaries[/b] for review.

What??? 
Why???
I heard that the one we’re sending it to might have it out for us.
Who did you hear that from?
Just some guys in production, but I’m pretty sure Mr. Gungand and Miss Odiche say the same thing.
I’m going to talk to Miss Odiche, then.
You’ll definitely hear about people who “got it out for us” from her.
Sure thing! Tried sparing you the conversation.
Haha, appreciate it, but there are some things you can’t escape.
[color=#ffed29](I need more information.)
I guess that would make sense as to why we failed three times in a row…

Right???
Bro, how can we succeed if the game is rigged against us?
Let’s get to it?
Yeah, I guess for us, it’s just time to work.
And we’ll kill it as always!
Herb, that isn’t true.
What makes you say that?

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Do I want Herb and Mrs. Langtree knowing that I went to the Apotheca?)

events.text: [color=#ffed29](I don’t think they’ll make a huge deal out of it?)
I might have talked to the apothecaries that reviewed us?
Boy…
Orbro...

[color=#ffed29](Uh oh…)
I talked to Miss Odiche and Mr. Gungand first! And they didn’t tell me [i]anything[/i]!

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]SO YOU WENT BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]BOY, ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND?
It’s pretty dangerous, Orbro…
What did this do?
Well, now I know [i]why[/i] we’re being denied! And—

AND WHAT?  
AND YOU’RE GOING TO TELL THE PEOPLE KEEPING THIS INFORMATION FROM YOU THAT YOU SUDDENLY KNOW THE ANSWER TO THEIR PROBLEMS?
OH SURE, I’M POSITIVE THEY’LL LISTEN TO YOU AFTER THEY SPECIFICALLY TRIED TO KEEP THIS PROBLEM FROM YOU.

OR MAYBE YOU’LL DO THIS BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
HOW LONG DO YOU THINK YOU CAN KEEP THAT UP?
I…I know it was impulsive, but what was I supposed to do???
Your job???

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]YOUR JOB, ORVEN.
THEY DON’T DESERVE THIS LEVEL OF DEDICATION!
But people need a cure for this disease!
And it’s going to come from you?
You want to stay in Ventreville, don’t you?
You want to work for Mister Avidine, right?
I mean, of course…

Then let this go. It won’t change anything.
They’re not willing to budge, so you’re wasting your time.

You understand me?
You’re going to do amazing things, but not under these nut jobs.
I know that I said I’d be behind you with whatever you do, but you’re not making it easy…
[color=#ffed29](…but then who will make the cure?)
I understand…

I know it sounds harsh, child, but it’s the way things are.
I just don’t want you getting fired.

No, I get that. Thanks for looking out for me, Mrs. Langtree.
Thank you, Herb.
No problem, bro.
I really like working with you guys, so I’d hate to get fired because of something dumb.
I really like working with you too, Orven.
You just gotta remember that this is the job that pays you, and nothing more.

You shouldn’t care more than your superiors.
If they aren’t worried, then neither are we.
Understood?
Understood.
This means a lot to you, right?
It does, Herb, I’m sorry.

You’re good, man, go talk to Miss Odiche.
Find out more.

??????
You sure?

I won’t tell Mrs. Langtree.
Go, Orbro, I told you I’d have your back.
You’re the best brother a guy could ask for.
[i]Haha[/i], that’s my line.

events.choice: I’d better play it safe and keep it to myself…

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Not that I don’t trust Herb, but I don’t want him getting caught up in what I’m doing.)
Well...
This fool went to the apotheca himself.
What???
Dude, Miss Odiche would FLIP if she found out you did that, that’s like an act of treason to her!
And, oh my gods, if Mr. Gungand found out, he’d KILL you.
I know that I said I’d be behind you with whatever you do, but you’re not making it easy…

I’m sorry, guys, really...I’m sorry.
I didn’t mean to cause any trouble.
You might not [i]mean[/i] to do that, but you are.
Yeah, I mean, I just don’t want you getting fired or something…
Me too.

Keep a watch over him, Herwin.
Don’t let him do anything stupid.
Yes, ma’am!
This means a lot to you, right?
It does, Herb, I’m sorry.

You’re good, man, go talk to Miss Odiche.
Find out more.

??????
You sure?

I won’t tell Mrs. Langtree.
Go, Orbro, I told you I’d have your back.
You’re the best brother a guy could ask for.
[i]Haha[/i], that’s my line.

events.name: If I didn't tell Ms. Langtree...

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](If I didn’t even tell Mrs. Langtree, I probably shouldn’t tell Herb.)
[color=#ffed29](He’s loyal for sure, but he just…has a lot of friends.)
There’s no way that an agency certified by the Magic and Medicine Academy could have a personal vendetta, those things are regulated!
Well, that’s why we’re looking for an agency [b]outside of the MMA.
Typical.

events.question: Well, that’s what I’ve heard. That we can do this without that seal and the product can get out and help people faster.

events.text: Herb…I feel like that’s really bad.
You think?
Doesn’t it feel like that would be unsafe?
Only if our product is unsafe.
Is our product safe???

… I think so…but… 
I guess I see how this looks bad…
Like, if it’s safe…then why are we trying to avoid the safety people?
RIGHT???
What should we do?

I…I don’t know…I need more information.  
I think I’m going to talk to Miss Odiche about this.

You don’t need to waste your breath.
She never does anything helpful.
It’s worth a shot though, right, Orbro?
For sure, man.
Good luck.
[color=#ffed29](I’ll need it.)
This is good?
Yeah, man! Getting our life-saving product out there!
Right…right, and that’s a good thing.
I’m glad you’re more hopeful today, you seemed pretty down yesterday.
Mhmm.
Don’t be bummed—come on, let’s do what we do best!

Yeah…
Yeah.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]ORBRO!

HERB!
Trying out the new nickname!
Feels good! Rolls off the tongue.
Where’s Mrs. Langtree?

Herb…
I think you might want to avoid Mrs. Langtree for a bit.
Why? Did something happen?
Kinda?
She just can't get behind your enthusiasm.

She’s not in a good place mentally, I think.
She seems stressed…and so, I think a lot of things push her buttons right now.
I mean, sure, that’s no problem for me.

I hope I didn’t offend her?
I was just trying to bring some hope back into the equation…

I think she sees it as false hope.
Which I think, to her, is worse…
Geez, Mrs. Langtree…I mean, it’s no problem, I’ll leave her alone.
But, I dunno, I hope her home life is good, she just sounds miserable.
Definitely stressed…

Thanks for the warning, Orbro.
I didn’t need to be yelled at this early.
Anytime, bro.
Mrs. Langtree’s probably working right now.
I think she’s busy?
Maybe we should just leave her alone today…
Still not over what happened yesterday?
Yeah...

Geez, she took it so hard...
Is she good to be working today?
You know that she can do her job with her eyes closed.

Yeah, that’s true…
She wants time for herself?
I think so.

Okay! I won’t bug her.
She'll just get a little nod from me and nothing else.
Thanks, Herb.

Well, thanks for the heads up, Orbro.
I definitely wouldn’t have picked this up on my own.
Haha, anytime, Herb.
ORVO!
HERB!

Hey, Mrs. Langtree!
You feeling okay?
As good as any day!
I’m glad!

You know, I’ve really been thinking about things that can help support Production morale.
And I was thinking, we should join a handball league!

Handball is great, Orvo, I’ll teach you the rules.
A lot of running and teamwork! Plus, you don’t need a ton of expensive equipment.
It’s scrappy, like us, you know?
Mrs. Langtree, you’re free to join too, of course. I’ve seen your strength, you would be a great addition!

My old joints can't dive for the balls.
But I used to play when I was younger.

Then you can be our COACH.
OH MY GOSH, this is perfect!
Uh, I dunno. I don’t wanna weigh you guys down.
I’m not great at sports.

We’ll train you! 
We need you for our underdog story!
I’ll watch a couple times, just to see what the rules are.
Okay, okay, only because I’m confident the art of handball will suck you in!
[i]Haha[/i], I look forward to it!
Um, sure?
YEAH!!! Orvo, it’s going to be SO fun.
PRODUCTION DOMINATION!!!
We wanna be in winners shape, can you get us there, Mrs. Langtree?
Are you willing to do what I’m coaching you to do?

SICK.
Dude, I’m so HYPE.
I’ll try not to drag us down too much!

[i]Ahh[/i], stop it, Orvo, you’ve got it.
It’s all for fun and teamwork anyway.
Oh, Orvo! I meant to tell you.
I heard from some guys that we’re going to be submitting our reviews to [b][i]different[/i] apothecaries[/b] for review.

What??? 
Really???
I heard that the one we’re sending it to might have it out for us.
Who did you hear that from?
Just some guys in production, but I’m pretty sure Mr. Gungand and Miss Odiche say the same thing.
I’m going to talk to Miss Odiche, then.
What for???

I just wanna see what’s up, you know?
Why’d they make this call?
Shouldn’t we just be trying to make our product as safe as possible?
Our product IS safe.
Is it??? Do you know that???
Of course! Why would they be making us make something unsafe???
Why did [b]Remedium[/b] fail THREE times?

Because they aren’t FAIR.
Orven, what’s your deal???
Do you not trust our supervisors [i]that much[/i]???

And even if you don’t, which I don’t, this isn’t your call, Orven.
You aren’t being paid enough to worry about stuff they’re supposed to be doing.

Yeah, you’re just a production line guy, like me. 
WE DON’T NEED TO KNOW.
Herwin, watch over Orven for me, alright?
Yes, ma’am.

…...
We’re doing this because we care, Orven.
We don’t want you getting fired or something. Or taking on work you shouldn’t. You get that, right?

Yeah, Herb.
Thanks, man.
Come on, bro.
I guess that would make sense as to why we failed three times in a row…
Right??? Bro, how can we succeed if the game is rigged against us?
Let’s get to it?
Yeah, I guess for us, it’s just time to work.
And we’ll kill it as always!
Herb, that isn’t true.
How could you say that???

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Do I want Herb and Mrs. Langtree knowing that I went to the Apotheca?)

events.text: [color=#ffed29](I don’t think they’ll make a huge deal out of it?)
I might have talked to the apothecaries that reviewed us?
Boy…
WHAT???

[color=#ffed29](Uh oh…)
I talked to Miss Odiche and Mr. Gungand first! And they didn’t tell me [i]anything[/i]!

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]SO YOU WENT BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]BOY, ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND?

YEAH, ARE YOU CRAZY, ORVEN??? 
GOING TO THE ENEMY???
What did this do?
Well now I know [i]why[/i] we’re being denied! And—

AND WHAT?  
AND YOU’RE GOING TO TELL THE PEOPLE KEEPING THIS INFORMATION FROM YOU THAT YOU SUDDENLY KNOW THE ANSWER TO THEIR PROBLEMS?
OH SURE, I’M POSITIVE THEY’LL LISTEN TO YOU AFTER THEY SPECIFICALLY TRIED TO KEEP THIS PROBLEM FROM YOU.
THEY’LL LISTEN TO SOME GUY IN PRODUCTION???

OR MAYBE YOU’LL DO THIS BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
HOW LONG DO YOU THINK YOU CAN KEEP THAT UP?
I…I know it was impulsive, but what was I supposed to do???
I DUNNO, WHAT WE’VE ALL BEEN DOING! OUR JOBS!
THEY DON’T DESERVE THIS LEVEL OF DEDICATION!
But people need a cure for this disease!
And it’s going to come from YOU?

You want to stay in Ventreville, don’t you?
You want to work for Mister Avidine, right?
I mean, of course…

Then let this go. It won’t change anything.
They’re not willing to budge, so you’re wasting your time.
We’re production assistants in the Avidine factory, so let’s do what we’re supposed to as [i]production assistants.
[color=#ffed29](…but then who will make the cure?)
I understand…

I know it sounds harsh, child, but it’s the way things are.
I just don’t want you getting fired.

No, I get that. Thanks for looking out for me, Mrs. Langtree.
Thank you, Herb.

No problem, bro.
Just don’t be acting out, that never helps anyone.
Understood.

You just gotta remember that this is the job that pays you, and nothing more.
You shouldn’t care more than your superiors.

If they aren’t worried, then neither are we.
Understood?
Understood.
Herwin, watch over Orven for me, alright?
Yes ma’am.

…...
We’re doing this because we care, Orven.
We don’t want you getting fired or something. Or taking on work you shouldn’t. You get that, right?

Yeah, Herb.
Thanks, man.
Come on, bro.

events.choice: I’d better play it safe and keep it to myself…

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Not that I don’t trust Herb, but I don’t want him getting caught up in what I’m doing.)
Well...
This fool went to the apotheca himself.

What???
Dude, what are you going there for??? Visiting the enemy team???
What were you thinking???
No one was telling me anything here!
Because YOU don’t need to know!!
You’re just [i]some guy[/i]! What are you THINKING???
I’m thinking that if we got denied approval THREE times, then something must be wrong with the product!!!
NOTHING IS WRONG WITH [b]REMEDIUM[/b]. There’s a problem with the people reviewing us!
Do you KNOW that???

It doesn’t MATTER, Orven.
YOU aren’t supposed to be making these calls.
Don’t take that responsibility on yourself.
Please, Orven, you’re not helping anyone.

Keep a watch over him, Herwin.
Don’t let him do anything stupid.
Yes, ma’am.

…...
Come on, Orvo, you know we’re just trying to watch your back.
I know…

It’s just not our job, you know? And people who have been here way longer and have more experience are watching over this.
So, you don’t have to worry about this.
Understood.
Time to go?
Yeah.
There’s no way that an agency certified by the Magic and Medicine Academy could have a personal vendetta, those things are regulated!
Well, that’s why we’re looking for an agency [b]outside of the MMA.
Typical.

events.question: Well, that’s what I’ve heard. That we can do this without that seal and the product can get out and help people faster.

events.text: Herb…I feel like that’s really bad.
Why? Why would us getting approved be bad???
Doesn’t it feel like that would be unsafe?
Only if our product is unsafe. Which it ISN’T.
Are you sure???
YES???
Orven, why would Miss Odiche or Mr. Gungand, or I don’t know, MISTER AVIDINE, be asking us to make something unsafe???
IF IT’S SAFE, THEN WHY ARE WE TRYING TO AVOID THE SAFETY PEOPLE???

WE AREN’T.
WE’RE GOING TO SAFETY PEOPLE WHO AREN’T UNDER SOME AGENDA.
To people who AREN’T CERTIFIED???

Orven, this isn’t your job.
Don’t worry about this nonsense!

Yeah, that’s what our superiors are doing!
They’re doing their job, and we do OURS.
BUT—
But NOTHING. IT’S NOT YOUR JOB, ORVEN.

But NOTHING. IT’S NOT YOUR JOB, ORVEN.
Remember that this is the job that pays you, and nothing more. You shouldn’t care more than your superiors.

If they aren’t worried, then neither are we.
Understood?
Understood.
Herwin, watch over Orven for me, alright?
Yes, ma’am.

…...
We’re doing this because we care, Orven.
We don’t want you getting fired or something. Or taking on work you shouldn’t. You get that, right?

Yeah, Herb.
Thanks, man.
Come on, bro.
This is good?
Yeah, man! Getting our life-saving product out there!
Right…right, and that’s a good thing.
Heck yeah!
Mhmm.
Come on, let’s do what we do best!
Yeah…Yeah!
ORVO!
HERB!

You know, I’ve really been thinking about things that can help support Production morale.
And I was thinking we should join a handball league!

Handball is great, Orvo, I’ll teach you the rules.
A lot of running and teamwork! Plus, you don’t need a ton of expensive equipment.
It’s scrappy, like us, you know?

Mrs. Langtree is free to join too, of course.
Bro, I’ve seen her forearms: she would KILL it at handball.

But it’ll be a ton of fun and we’ll become closer and more unified as friends and coworkers!
Great idea, right?
Uh, I dunno. I don’t wanna weigh you guys down.

Uh, I dunno. I don’t wanna weigh you guys down.
I’m not great at sports.

We’ll train you! 
We need you for our underdog story!
I’ll watch a couple times, just to see what the rules are.
Okay, okay, only because I’m confident the art of handball will suck you in!
[i]Haha[/i], I look forward to it!
Um, sure?
YEAH!!! Orvo, it’s going to be SO fun.

PRODUCTION DOMINATION!!!
Dude, I’m so HYPE.
I’ll try not to drag us down too much!

[i]Ahh[/i], stop it Orvo, you’ve got it.
It’s all for fun and teamwork anyway.
